title: Gallery Talk: Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Dutch Golden Age
title_display: Gallery Talk: Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Dutch Golden Age
hero_caption: Rembrandt van Rijn. Kostverloren Castle in Decay, about 1652. Clarence Buckingham Collection.
description:
Explore Dutch and Flemish drawings made during the 16th- and 17th-century “Golden Age,” including works by artists such as Peter Paul Rubens and Rembrandt van Rijn.

Please note: This tour has limited capacity. Participation will be on a first-come, first-served basis.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program. 

Please note that the image on this page is for reference purposes only and may not be featured during the gallery talk.
